title: [Large-scale] TE-RME-based Pre-service Mathematics Teachers' Numeracy and Language Integration Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic math content and secondary curriculum understanding, digital tool proficiency, foundational grammar comprehension and text analysis skills
context.additional_context: Emphasizes linguistic expression (writing, reading comprehension) when performing real-life problem-solving projects reflecting cultural contexts. Digital collaboration tools are mandatory, with peer assessments including additional evaluation of linguistic clarity.

learning_goals: Applying the 4 stages of the TE-RME framework (Exploration, Expansion, Restructuring, Evaluation), learners design 3 math problems reflecting cultural contexts (e.g., holidays, traditional games), optimize linguistic expressions (text structure, vocabulary selection) during problem-solving, and achieve an "Excellent" grade in ≥2 of 4 peer evaluation rubric items (creativity, cultural appropriateness, mathematical accuracy, linguistic clarity).
Learners complete ≥3 digital tool-based (GeoGebra, Padlet, etc.) math proficiency assessment tasks and strengthen communication skills through oral/written explanations of their results.

Incorporating ≥3 peer feedbacks, learners submit a job-linked math lesson design proposal for corporate settings 3 days before course completion, achieving an "Excellent" grade in ≥4 of 5 rubric items (problem design, cultural integration, mathematical accuracy, linguistic expression, practicality).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
